question: How do I reset my password?
response: To reset your password, click on the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page. Enter your email address, and we'll send you instructions to create a new password.

question: What payment methods do you accept?
response: We accept major credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, American Express) and PayPal. For enterprise customers, we also offer invoicing options.

question: Can I integrate your service with Salesforce?
response: Yes, we offer a Salesforce integration. You can find step-by-step instructions in our developer documentation. The process involves creating an API key and configuring the connection in your Salesforce account.

question: How do I add a new user to my account?
response: To add a new user, go to 'Settings' > 'User Management' > 'Invite User'. Enter the email address of the new user and select their role. They'll receive an invitation to join your account.

question: What's included in the Enterprise plan?
response: Our Enterprise plan includes unlimited users, priority support, custom integrations, advanced analytics, and dedicated account management. For a full feature comparison, please visit our pricing page.

question: How secure is my data on your platform?
response: We take data security seriously. We use bank-level encryption, regular security audits, and comply with SOC 2 and GDPR requirements. All data is encrypted at rest and in transit.

question: I'm being charged incorrectly. How do I dispute this?
response: We're sorry to hear about the incorrect charge. Please contact our billing support team at billing@example.com with your account details and the specific charge in question. We'll investigate and resolve the issue promptly.

question: How do I export my data?
response: To export your data, go to 'Reports' > 'Data Export'. Select the date range and type of data you want to export. Click 'Generate Export' and you'll receive an email when your export is ready for download.

question: What's your uptime guarantee?
response: We guarantee 99.9% uptime for our services. This is backed by our Service Level Agreement (SLA). In the event of any unscheduled downtime, we provide service credits as outlined in our SLA.

question: How do I cancel my subscription?
response: To cancel your subscription, go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Subscription'. Click on 'Cancel Subscription' and follow the prompts. Please note that cancellation will be effective at the end of your current billing cycle.

question: Can I change my plan?
response: Yes, you can change your plan at any time. Go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Subscription' and click on 'Change Plan'. Select your desired plan and confirm. The changes will be prorated for your current billing cycle.

question: How do I set up two-factor authentication?
response: To set up two-factor authentication, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'Two-Factor Authentication'. Click 'Enable 2FA' and follow the setup wizard. You can choose between SMS or an authenticator app for the second factor.

question: What APIs do you offer?
response: We offer RESTful APIs for most of our services, including data retrieval, user management, and reporting. Full documentation, including endpoints and example requests, can be found in our API documentation.

question: How often do you release updates?
response: We typically release minor updates weekly and major feature updates monthly. All updates are automatically applied to your account. You can find our release notes and upcoming features on our product updates page.

question: I forgot my username. How can I recover it?
response: If you've forgotten your username, you can recover it by clicking 'Forgot Username' on the login page. Enter the email address associated with your account, and we'll send your username to that email.

question: Do you offer a non-profit discount?
response: Yes, we offer discounts for eligible non-profit organizations. Please contact our sales team at sales@example.com with your organization's details and proof of non-profit status. We'll review your application and get back to you with discount options.

question: How do I set up email notifications?
response: To set up email notifications, go to 'Settings' > 'Notifications'. You can choose which events trigger notifications and customize the frequency. Make sure to click 'Save Changes' after making your selections.

question: What's your data retention policy?
response: We retain user data for the duration of your active subscription plus 30 days after account closure. After this period, data is permanently deleted from our systems. You can request earlier deletion by contacting our support team.

question: How do I generate an API key?
response: To generate an API key, go to 'Settings' > 'API & Integrations' > 'API Keys'. Click 'Generate New Key', give it a name, and select the appropriate permissions. Remember to copy the key immediately, as it won't be displayed again.

question: Can I get an invoice for my subscription?
response: Yes, you can access and download invoices for your subscription. Go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Invoices'. Here you'll find a list of all your invoices, which you can view or download as PDFs.

question: How do I create a custom report?
response: To create a custom report, go to 'Reports' > 'Custom Reports' > 'New Report'. Choose your data sources, select the metrics and dimensions you want to include, and set any filters. You can then save and schedule the report as needed.

question: What's your refund policy?
response: Our refund policy allows for a full refund within the first 14 days of a new subscription. After this period, refunds are generally not provided for subscription fees. For specific cases, please contact our billing support team.

question: How do I set up SSO (Single Sign-On)?
response: SSO setup is available for Enterprise plans. To configure SSO, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'Single Sign-On'. Choose your identity provider (e.g., Okta, Azure AD) and follow the setup instructions. Contact support if you need assistance.

question: Can I white-label your product?
response: White-labeling is available for Enterprise customers. It allows you to customize the interface with your logo and colors. To explore this option, please contact your account manager or our sales team for details and pricing.

question: How do I track user activity in my account?
response: To track user activity, go to 'Reports' > 'Audit Logs'. Here you can view a detailed log of user actions, including logins, changes to settings, and data access. You can filter by user, action type, and date range.

question: How do I set up a team workspace?
response: To set up a team workspace, go to 'Settings' > 'Workspaces' > 'Create New Workspace'. Name your workspace, add team members, and set permissions. You can then customize the workspace with relevant projects and tools.

question: What's the difference between Basic and Pro plans?
response: The main differences are: Pro offers more storage, advanced analytics, priority support, and additional integrations. Basic is suitable for individuals or small teams, while Pro is designed for growing businesses. You can find a detailed comparison on our pricing page.

question: How do I troubleshoot slow performance?
response: To troubleshoot slow performance: 1) Check your internet connection, 2) Clear your browser cache, 3) Ensure you're using a supported browser version, 4) Check our status page for any ongoing issues. If problems persist, contact our support team with details about the issue.

question: Can I get a discount for annual billing?
response: Yes, we offer a 10% discount for annual billing on all our plans. To switch to annual billing, go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Billing Cycle' and select 'Annual'. The discount will be applied to your next billing cycle.

question: How do I add custom fields to my forms?
response: To add custom fields, go to 'Forms' > 'Edit Form' > 'Add Field'. Choose the field type (text, dropdown, etc.), set the field properties, and click 'Save'. You can then drag and drop to position the new field within your form.

question: What happens to my data if I cancel my subscription?
response: If you cancel your subscription, your data remains accessible for 30 days, during which you can export it. After 30 days, the data is permanently deleted from our systems. We recommend exporting your data before cancelling if you wish to retain it.

question: How do I set up automated reports?
response: To set up automated reports, go to 'Reports' > 'Scheduled Reports' > 'Create Schedule'. Choose the report type, set the frequency (daily, weekly, monthly), specify recipients, and select the delivery method (email, Slack, etc.). Click 'Save' to activate.

question: Do you offer a trial period?
response: Yes, we offer a 14-day free trial for all our plans. You can sign up for the trial on our website without entering credit card information. If you decide to continue, you can upgrade to a paid plan at any time during or after the trial.

question: How do I update my billing information?
response: To update your billing information, go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Payment Methods'. Click 'Edit' next to your current method or 'Add New Method' to enter new card details. Make sure to click 'Save Changes' when you're done.

question: Can I use your API with Python?
response: Yes, our API can be used with Python. We provide a Python SDK that simplifies API interactions. You can find installation instructions, code examples, and full documentation in our Developer Center. Make sure to use Python 3.6 or later for compatibility.

question: How do I set user permissions?
response: To set user permissions, go to 'Settings' > 'User Management' > 'Roles & Permissions'. You can either assign users to predefined roles or create custom roles with specific permissions. Click on a user to modify their individual permissions.

question: What's your GDPR compliance status?
response: We are fully GDPR compliant. We've implemented necessary measures including data encryption, user consent management, and data portability. Our Data Processing Agreement (DPA) outlines our commitments. For specific queries, contact our Data Protection Officer.

question: How do I connect to my database?
response: To connect your database, go to 'Settings' > 'Integrations' > 'Databases'. Click 'Add New Connection', select your database type, and enter the connection details (host, port, credentials). Test the connection before saving. Ensure your firewall allows our IP.

question: Can I change my billing cycle?
response: Yes, you can change your billing cycle. Go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Billing Cycle'. You can switch between monthly and annual billing. If switching to annual, you'll receive a prorated credit for the remainder of your current month.

question: How do I set up email templates?
response: To set up email templates, navigate to 'Settings' > 'Communications' > 'Email Templates'. Click 'Create New Template', design your template using our WYSIWYG editor or HTML, and save. You can then use these templates in automated emails or campaigns.

question: What's your data backup policy?
response: We perform daily backups of all customer data, which are encrypted and stored in geographically distributed locations. We retain daily backups for 30 days and monthly backups for 12 months. Backups are tested regularly to ensure data integrity and recoverability.

question: How do I generate an API token?
response: To generate an API token, go to 'Settings' > 'API & Integrations' > 'API Tokens'. Click 'Generate New Token', give it a name and set the expiration. Copy the token immediately as it won't be displayed again. Remember to keep your tokens secure.

question: Do you offer phone support?
response: Phone support is available for Enterprise plan customers. If you're on an Enterprise plan, you can find your dedicated support number in 'Settings' > 'Support'. For other plans, we offer email and chat support with competitive response times.

question: How do I set up multi-factor authentication?
response: To set up multi-factor authentication, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'Multi-Factor Authentication'. Click 'Enable MFA', choose your preferred method (app, SMS, or security key), and follow the setup wizard. We recommend using an authenticator app for best security.

question: Can I get a copy of our Service Level Agreement?
response: Yes, you can access our Service Level Agreement (SLA) in your account. Go to 'Settings' > 'Legal & Compliance' > 'Service Agreements'. You can view and download the SLA applicable to your plan. For custom SLAs, please contact your account manager.

question: How do I customize the dashboard?
response: To customize your dashboard, go to 'Dashboard' and click 'Customize' in the top right. You can add, remove, or rearrange widgets by dragging and dropping. Click on individual widgets to configure their settings. Don't forget to save your changes when done.

question: What payment currencies do you support?
response: We support payments in USD, EUR, GBP, CAD, and AUD. Your account will be billed in the currency you select during signup. To change your billing currency, please contact our support team. Note that changing currency may affect your pricing.

question: How do I set up webhooks?
response: To set up webhooks, go to 'Settings' > 'API & Integrations' > 'Webhooks'. Click 'Add Webhook', enter the destination URL, select the events you want to trigger the webhook, and save. You can test the webhook before activating it in your production environment.

question: What's your privacy policy?
response: Our privacy policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your data. It covers data processing, sharing practices, and your rights as a user. You can find the full policy on our website. We regularly update it to comply with the latest regulations.

question: How do I invite external collaborators?
response: To invite external collaborators, go to 'Settings' > 'User Management' > 'External Collaborators'. Click 'Invite Collaborator', enter their email, set permissions, and send the invite. External collaborators have limited access and are clearly marked in the system.

question: How do I enable IP restrictions for my account?
response: To enable IP restrictions, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'IP Restrictions'. Click 'Enable IP Restrictions' and add the IP addresses or ranges you want to allow. Remember to include your current IP to avoid locking yourself out. Save changes when done.

question: Can I get a breakdown of my usage?
response: Yes, you can view a detailed breakdown of your usage. Go to 'Settings' > 'Billing' > 'Usage Reports'. Here you'll find charts and tables showing your usage across different features. You can export this data or set up alerts for usage thresholds.

question: How do I set up SAML authentication?
response: SAML authentication is available for Enterprise plans. To set it up, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'SAML Configuration'. You'll need to enter your Identity Provider details, upload metadata, and configure assertions. Contact support if you need assistance.

question: What's your uptime history?
response: We maintain a public status page that shows our uptime history and any past incidents. You can find this at status.example.com. We're proud to consistently achieve over 99.9% uptime. For specific uptime guarantees, please refer to our SLA.

question: How do I create a custom integration?
response: To create a custom integration, use our API and webhooks. Start by generating an API key in 'Settings' > 'API & Integrations'. Then, refer to our API documentation for available endpoints. For complex integrations, consider using our SDKs available in various programming languages.

question: Can I transfer my subscription to another account?
response: Subscription transfers between accounts are handled on a case-by-case basis. Please contact our support team with details of both the current and intended account holders. We'll review your request and guide you through the process if it's approved.

question: How do I set up automated workflows?
response: To set up automated workflows, go to 'Automation' > 'Workflows' > 'Create Workflow'. Define your trigger event, set conditions, and add actions. You can use our visual workflow builder to connect steps. Test your workflow before activating it in production.

question: What certifications does your platform have?
response: We hold several industry-standard certifications including SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, and PCI DSS. We're also HIPAA compliant for customers in healthcare. You can find detailed information about our certifications and compliance on our security page.

question: How do I export all my data?
response: To export all your data, go to 'Settings' > 'Account' > 'Data Export'. Click 'Request Full Export'. We'll prepare a complete export of your data in a standard format (usually CSV or JSON). This process may take several hours for large accounts.

question: Can I customize the login page?
response: Login page customization is available for Enterprise plans. Go to 'Settings' > 'Branding' > 'Login Page'. Here you can upload your logo, set custom colors, and add a background image. Changes will be reflected on your unique login URL.

question: What's your data residency policy?
response: We offer data residency options for customers with specific geographic requirements. By default, data is stored in our US or EU data centers. For Enterprise customers, we can provide dedicated instances in specific regions. Contact sales for more information.

question: How do I set up role-based access control?
response: To set up role-based access control, go to 'Settings' > 'User Management' > 'Roles'. Create custom roles with specific permissions, then assign users to these roles. You can also modify existing roles. Changes to roles will affect all users assigned to them.

question: Do you offer volume discounts?
response: Yes, we offer volume discounts for large user counts or high usage volumes. These are typically negotiated for Enterprise plans. Please contact our sales team with details about your expected usage, and they'll provide a custom quote.

question: How do I use the API to create new users?
response: To create users via API, use the POST /users endpoint. Send a JSON payload with the user's details (email, name, role, etc.). You'll need to authenticate with an API key that has user management permissions. Refer to our API docs for full details and examples.

question: What's your incident response process?
response: Our incident response process involves: 1) Detection and alerting, 2) Assessment and triage, 3) Containment and mitigation, 4) Customer communication, 5) Resolution and recovery, 6) Post-incident review. We commit to transparent communication throughout the process.

question: How do I set up custom domains?
response: To set up a custom domain, go to 'Settings' > 'Custom Domains' > 'Add Domain'. Enter your domain and follow the DNS configuration instructions. Once verified, you can use this domain for your account's public pages. SSL certificates are automatically provisioned.

question: Can I get an on-premise version of your software?
response: We offer on-premise deployments for Enterprise customers with specific security or regulatory requirements. This involves a custom implementation process and may affect pricing and feature availability. Please contact our sales team to discuss your needs.

question: How do I configure SSO with Azure AD?
response: To configure SSO with Azure AD, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'Single Sign-On'. Select Azure AD as your provider. You'll need to configure both our platform and Azure AD. We provide step-by-step instructions, including the necessary URLs and certificates.

question: What's your refund policy for unused time?
response: We offer prorated refunds for unused time if you cancel an annual subscription early. Monthly subscriptions are not eligible for partial refunds. To request a refund, contact our billing support team with your account details and cancellation date.

question: How do I use the bulk import feature?
response: To use bulk import, go to 'Data' > 'Import' > 'Bulk Import'. Choose the data type you're importing, download our template CSV, fill it with your data, and upload. Review the preview, map fields if necessary, and confirm. Large imports run in the background.

question: What's your approach to ethical AI use?
response: We're committed to ethical AI use, following principles of fairness, transparency, privacy, and human oversight. We regularly audit our AI systems for bias, provide clear information on AI-driven features, and allow users to opt-out of AI processing where possible.

question: How do I set up multi-region failover?
response: Multi-region failover is available for Enterprise plans. Contact your account manager to enable this feature. Once activated, go to 'Settings' > 'Infrastructure' > 'Failover Configuration' to set your primary and secondary regions, and define failover policies.

question: Can I get a signed BAA for HIPAA compliance?
response: Yes, we offer Business Associate Agreements (BAA) for customers who require HIPAA compliance. This is typically part of our Enterprise plan. Contact your account manager or our sales team to initiate the BAA process. We'll review your needs and provide the agreement.

question: How do I use the query builder for reports?
response: To use the advanced query builder, go to 'Reports' > 'Custom Reports' > 'Query Builder'. Here you can write SQL-like queries to create complex reports. Use our visual query builder or write raw queries. You can join multiple data sources and apply various transformations.

question: What's your policy on third-party audits?
response: We welcome third-party audits for Enterprise customers, subject to our security protocols. This typically involves signing an NDA and agreeing on the scope. We can provide our latest audit reports and certifications. For a third-party audit request, contact your account manager.

question: How do I set up a custom OAuth provider?
response: To set up a custom OAuth provider, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'OAuth Providers' > 'Add Custom Provider'. You'll need to enter the provider's endpoints, client ID, and secret. Then, configure scopes and attribute mapping. Test the setup before enabling it for users.

question: What's your policy on data deletion?
response: When you request data deletion, we permanently remove your data from our active systems within 30 days. Backups are overwritten within 90 days. We provide a certificate of deletion upon request. Note that some data may be retained if required by law.

question: How do I set up a staging environment?
response: To set up a staging environment, go to 'Settings' > 'Environments' > 'Create New'. Choose 'Staging' as the type. You can then clone your production data or start fresh. Use the provided subdomain or set up a custom domain for staging. Remember to set appropriate access controls.

question: Can I get an enterprise-wide license?
response: Yes, we offer enterprise-wide licenses for large organizations. These typically include unlimited users, priority support, and custom terms. Contact our sales team with details about your organization's size and needs. We'll create a tailored enterprise license proposal.

question: How do I use the API pagination feature?
response: Our API uses cursor-based pagination for list endpoints. Include a 'limit' parameter to set the page size. The response includes a 'next_cursor' field if there are more results. To get the next page, include this cursor value in your next request as the 'cursor' parameter.

question: What's your approach to sustainable computing?
response: We're committed to sustainable computing. Our data centers use renewable energy sources where possible. We optimize our algorithms for energy efficiency and use efficient hardware. We also offset our carbon footprint and are working towards carbon neutrality by 2025.

question: How do I set up custom alerts?
response: To set up custom alerts, go to 'Monitoring' > 'Alerts' > 'Create Alert'. Choose the metric to monitor, set thresholds, and define the alert message. You can send alerts via email, SMS, or integrate with tools like PagerDuty. Test your alert before saving it.

question: Do you offer academic or educational discounts?
response: Yes, we offer discounts for academic institutions and educational projects. Eligible organizations can receive up to 50% off our standard pricing. To apply, contact our sales team with proof of your academic status. We'll review your application and provide a custom quote.

question: How do I implement row-level security?
response: To implement row-level security, use our data policies feature. Go to 'Settings' > 'Data Management' > 'Data Policies'. Create a new policy, define the conditions for data access, and apply it to specific tables or views. You can use user attributes in your policy definitions.

question: What's your product roadmap?
response: We maintain a public roadmap of upcoming features and improvements. You can view it at example.com/roadmap. It's updated quarterly and includes both near-term and long-term plans. For Enterprise customers, we offer private roadmap sessions with our product team.

question: How do I set up A/B testing?
response: To set up A/B testing, go to 'Analytics' > 'A/B Tests' > 'Create Test'. Define your variants, set the audience split, and choose your success metrics. You can run tests on UI elements, features, or algorithms. Use our statistical engine to determine when results are significant.

question: What's your SLA for Enterprise customers?
response: Our Enterprise SLA typically guarantees 99.99% uptime, 24/7 support with 1-hour response time for critical issues, and financial penalties for any breaches. The exact terms can be customized based on your needs. Contact your account manager for your specific SLA details.

question: How do I use the bulk update API?
response: To use the bulk update API, send a POST request to the /bulk-update endpoint with an array of objects to update. Each object should include an ID and the fields to update. The API processes these in batches for efficiency. Check the response for success status and any error details.

question: Can you provide a SOC 2 report?
response: Yes, we can provide our SOC 2 Type II report under a non-disclosure agreement (NDA). This report is updated annually and covers our security, availability, and confidentiality controls. Contact your account manager or our security team to request the report and initiate the NDA process.

question: How do I set up a custom error page?
response: To set up a custom error page, go to 'Settings' > 'Branding' > 'Error Pages'. You can upload an HTML file for each error type (404, 500, etc.) or use our template editor. Ensure your custom pages include links back to your main application to help users navigate errors.

question: What's your data encryption policy?
response: We use industry-standard encryption for data at rest and in transit. All data is encrypted at rest using AES-256, and we use TLS 1.2+ for data in transit. Database backups are also encrypted. For Enterprise customers, we offer the option of customer-managed encryption keys.

question: How do I implement single logout?
response: To implement single logout, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'SSO Configuration' > 'Logout Settings'. Enable single logout and provide the logout URL for your identity provider. When a user logs out of your app, we'll send a logout request to this URL to end all associated sessions.

question: Do you offer a bug bounty program?
response: Yes, we run a bug bounty program to encourage responsible disclosure of security vulnerabilities. Rewards vary based on the severity and impact of the reported issues. You can find details about the program, including scope and rules, on our security page.

question: How do I use the GraphQL API?
response: To use our GraphQL API, send POST requests to the /graphql endpoint with your query in the request body. You'll need to authenticate with an API key in the Authorization header. Use introspection to explore available types and fields. We provide client libraries for popular languages.

question: What's your policy on data portability?
response: We support data portability as part of our commitment to user rights and compliance with regulations like GDPR. You can export your data at any time in standard, machine-readable formats. Go to 'Settings' > 'Account' > 'Data Export' to request a full export of your data.

question: How do I implement CAPTCHA on forms?
response: To add CAPTCHA to your forms, go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'CAPTCHA Configuration'. Enable CAPTCHA and choose the type (image, audio, or invisible). You can customize the appearance and behavior. Once enabled, CAPTCHA will be automatically added to designated form submissions.

question: Can I get a dedicated account manager?
response: Dedicated account managers are provided for Enterprise customers and accounts above a certain usage threshold. They offer personalized support, strategic advice, and act as your primary point of contact. Contact our sales team to discuss upgrading to a plan with dedicated account management.

question: How do I use the recommendation engine API?
response: To use the recommendation engine API, send a POST request to /recommendations with user_id and context parameters. The API returns personalized recommendations based on user behavior and item characteristics. You can fine-tune recommendations by adjusting weights in the request.

question: What's your policy on penetration testing?
response: We allow customers to conduct penetration tests on their own instances, subject to our guidelines. You must notify us in advance and agree to our penetration testing terms. We can provide a safe testing environment upon request. Contact our security team to schedule a penetration test.

question: How do I implement federated search?
response: To implement federated search, go to 'Settings' > 'Search' > 'Federated Search'. Add the external data sources you want to include in your search results. Configure the search weights for each source and set up any necessary API connections. Test your configuration before enabling it.

question: How do I set up event tracking?
response: To set up event tracking, go to 'Analytics' > 'Event Tracking' > 'Create New Event'. Define the event name, properties, and triggers. You can track user actions, system events, or custom events. Use our SDK or API to send events from your application. View tracked events in the analytics dashboard.

question: What's your policy on data localization?
response: We offer data localization options for customers with specific regulatory requirements. By default, data is stored in our primary data centers, but we can provision dedicated instances in specific geographic regions for Enterprise customers. This may affect pricing and some feature availability.

question: How do I implement custom authentication?
response: To implement custom authentication, use our Authentication SDK. Go to 'Settings' > 'Security' > 'Custom Authentication' to get your SDK keys. Implement the authentication flow in your application, handling user credentials and token management. Our SDK provides methods for login, logout, and session management.

question: Do you offer a partner program?
response: Yes, we have a partner program for consultants, resellers, and technology partners. Partners get access to training, co-marketing opportunities, and revenue sharing. Visit our partners page to learn about the different tiers and benefits. You can apply online or contact our partnerships team.

question: How do I use the machine learning pipeline?
response: To use the machine learning pipeline, go to 'AI & ML' > 'Pipelines' > 'Create Pipeline'. Define your data sources, preprocessing steps, model selection, and evaluation metrics. You can use our pre-built models or import your own. Set up automated retraining and model deployment from the pipeline.

question: What's your approach to accessibility compliance?
response: We're committed to making our platform accessible to all users. We follow WCAG 2.1 AA standards and regularly audit our interface for compliance. Features include keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and customizable contrast. We provide an accessibility statement and VPAT upon request.

question: How do I implement real-time collaboration?
response: To implement real-time collaboration, use our Collaboration API. Initialize the collaboration client in your app, subscribe to document changes, and broadcast user actions. Handle conflict resolution using our built-in OT algorithm. You can customize the collaboration UI using our React components.

question: Can I get a custom contract?
response: Yes, we offer custom contracts for Enterprise customers or those with specific regulatory needs. This may include custom terms, SLAs, or data processing agreements. Contact our sales team to discuss your requirements. Note that custom contracts may affect pricing and implementation timelines.

question: How do I use the content delivery network?
response: To use our content delivery network, go to 'Settings' > 'Performance' > 'CDN Configuration'. Enable the CDN and select the assets you want to distribute (images, static files, etc.). Configure caching rules and purge options. Use the provided CDN URLs in your application to serve content from the nearest edge location.

question: What's your policy on third-party data sharing?
response: We do not sell customer data to third parties. We only share data with third parties as necessary to provide our services (e.g., cloud hosting providers) or as required by law. All third-party vendors are vetted for security and compliance. You can find details in our privacy policy and DPA.

question: How do I implement multi-tenant architecture?
response: To implement multi-tenant architecture, use our Multi-Tenant SDK. Design your data model with tenant isolation, either through separate databases or row-level security. Use the SDK to manage tenant provisioning, data separation, and cross-tenant operations. Configure tenant-specific branding and settings in the admin panel.

question: Do you offer a bug tracking system?
response: Yes, we provide a bug tracking system for reporting and monitoring issues. Go to 'Support' > 'Bug Tracker' to submit new bugs or check the status of existing ones. You can categorize issues, set priorities, and attach relevant files. Our support team uses this system to communicate updates and resolutions.

question: How do I implement serverless functions?
response: To implement serverless functions, use our Serverless SDK. Go to 'Development' > 'Serverless' > 'Create Function'. Write your function code, set up triggers (HTTP, event-based, or scheduled), and deploy. You can monitor function performance and logs in the dashboard. Use environment variables for configuration.

question: What's your policy on data subject access requests?
response: We support Data Subject Access Requests (DSARs) in compliance with GDPR and other privacy regulations. Users can request access to their personal data via our privacy portal. We provide a complete record of stored personal data within 30 days. You can also use our API to automate DSAR fulfillment.

question: How do I implement custom dashboards?
response: To implement custom dashboards, go to 'Analytics' > 'Dashboards' > 'Create Custom Dashboard'. Use our drag-and-drop interface to add and arrange widgets. Each widget can display different data visualizations. You can create multiple dashboards for different purposes or user roles. Use our Dashboard API for programmatic customization.

question: Can I get a demo environment for sales purposes?
response: Yes, we provide demo environments for partners and customers conducting sales demonstrations. Contact our sales team to request a demo environment. We'll set up a sanitized instance with sample data relevant to your target industry. The demo environment includes all features and can be customized for specific use cases.

question: How do I implement blue-green deployments?
response: To implement blue-green deployments, use our Deployment Manager. Go to 'DevOps' > 'Deployment Strategies' > 'Blue-Green'. Set up two identical production environments (blue and green). Use our traffic management tools to switch between them during deployments. This allows for zero-downtime updates and easy rollbacks.

question: What's your policy on employee background checks?
response: We conduct comprehensive background checks on all employees and contractors who have access to customer data or critical systems. This includes criminal records, employment verification, and education checks. We also perform regular security training and assessments for all staff. Details are available in our security whitepaper.

question: How do I implement custom search algorithms?
response: To implement custom search algorithms, use our Search Customization API. Go to 'Search' > 'Custom Algorithms' > 'Create Algorithm'. Define your ranking factors, boosting rules, and any machine learning models. You can test your algorithm against sample queries and fine-tune it based on relevance metrics.

question: Do you offer volume-based pricing?
response: Yes, we offer volume-based pricing for customers with high usage. Pricing tiers are based on factors like number of users, API calls, or data storage. Volume discounts are automatically applied as you reach higher tiers. For large-scale usage, contact our sales team for custom volume pricing plans.

question: How do I implement feature flags?
response: To implement feature flags, use our Feature Management SDK. Go to 'Development' > 'Feature Flags' > 'Create Flag'. Define the flag name, variations, and targeting rules. Use the SDK in your code to check flag states and alter behavior accordingly. You can update flags in real-time from the dashboard.
tags: feature flags, A/B testing, product management

question: What's your policy on data anonymization?
response: We offer data anonymization features to help you comply with privacy regulations. Go to 'Data Management' > 'Anonymization' to set up rules. You can anonymize specific fields, use pseudonymization, or apply k-anonymity algorithms. Anonymization can be applied to exports, reports, or live data based on user roles.

question: How do I implement WebSocket connections?
response: To implement WebSocket connections, use our Real-Time Communication SDK. Initialize the WebSocket client with your API key. Subscribe to relevant channels or topics. Handle incoming messages and send updates as needed. You can implement features like real-time notifications, live updates, or chat functionality using WebSockets.

question: Can I get a security questionnaire filled out?
response: Yes, we can complete security questionnaires for potential or current customers. Contact your account manager or our security team to request this. We have pre-filled responses for common questionnaires (SIG, CAIQ, etc.). For custom questionnaires, we typically need 5-10 business days to provide comprehensive responses.

question: How do I implement custom workflows?
response: To implement custom workflows, use our Workflow Builder. Go to 'Automation' > 'Workflows' > 'Create Workflow'. Define triggers, conditions, and actions using our visual editor. You can integrate with external systems via webhooks, use branching logic, and set up approval processes. Test your workflow before activating it in production.
